data.overview: Finland Lapland is all about canopy layers, respectful wildlife watching, and trail pacing. Expect misty mornings and plan for leeches, drizzle, and mossy boardwalks.

top_sights.title: Canopy suspension circuit
top_sights.why_go: Rangers brief visitors on bird calls and primate etiquette before the walk.

top_sights.title: Finland Lapland waterfall amphitheater
top_sights.why_go: Short hike with spray-cooled viewpoints and natural pools.
top_sights.best_time: Midday when light hits the falls

top_sights.title: Night walk for bioluminescence
top_sights.why_go: Guides teach low-light etiquette and identify frogs without flashlights.

itineraries.title: 2–3 Day Highlights
stops: Loop trail to remote research station

seasonality.pros: Best for long treks and wildlife

local_tips: Pack quick-dry layers plus a lightweight poncho; cotton stays damp for days.
Walk single-file and keep voices low to avoid startling wildlife.
Confirm FI park permits; some biosphere zones cap entries daily.
safety: Hire certified guides for night walks; the trail network gets tricky after rain.
Carry basic leech socks and antihistamines in your daypack.
Treat all water with filters or UV pens even inside lodges.

transport.from_airport: Minivans connect the regional airport to trailhead towns twice daily.
transport.getting_around: Shared 4x4 shuttles and river boats reach most lodges.
transport.passes: Multi-day park wristbands save on ranger fees.
